tool.name: GetToolInfo

param.name: serviceName
param.expression: asyncClosestFacility | asyncLocationAllocation | asyncRoute | asyncServiceArea | asyncVRP | syncVRP
param.dialogReference:
Specify the service name containing the tool. The parameter value should be specified using one of the following keywords that reference a particular geoprocessing service.

  • asyncClosestFacility - The asynchronous geoprocessing service used to perform the closest facility analysis.

  • asyncLocationAllocation - The asynchronous geoprocessing service used to perform the location-allocation analysis.

  • asyncRoute - The asynchronous geoprocessing service used to perform the route analysis.

  • asyncServiceArea - The asynchronous geoprocessing service used to perform the service area analysis.

  • asyncVRP - The asynchronous geoprocessing service used to perform the vehicle routing problem analysis.

  • syncVRP - The synchronous geoprocessing service used to perform the vehicle routing problem analysis.

The default value is asyncRoute.

param.name: toolName
param.dialogReference: Specify the tool name in the geoprocessing service. The parameter value should be a valid tool name in the geoprocessing service specified by the serviceName parameter. The default value is FindRoutes.

tool.summary: Get additional information such as the description of the network dataset used for the analysis and the execution limits for a tool in a geoprocessing service.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Get additional information such as the description of the network dataset used for the analysis and the execution limits for a tool in a geoprocessing service.

Consts.useLimit: This tool is available for users with an ArcGIS Online organizational subscription. To access this geoprocessing tool, you'll need to sign in with an account that is a member of an organizational subscription. Executing this tool does not incur service credits.
